articles.author: Charles Q. Choi
articles.title: 45000-year-old bones unearthed in cave are oldest modern-human remains in Central Europe - Livescience.com
articles.description: The finding suggests that 'successive pulses of small groups' of humans replaced Neanderthals in Europe starting around 45,000 years ago.
articles.content: Modern humans crossed the Alps into chilly Northern Europe about 45,000 years ago, meaning they may have coexisted with Neanderthals in Europe for thousands of years longer than experts previously th… [+6640 chars]
